channel.title: WebdriverIO on Vidhi Mody
channel.description: Recent content in WebdriverIO on Vidhi Mody

item.title: GSoCpedia: Chapter Two
item.description: “Its the not the Destination, It’s the journey.” ~ Ralph Waldo It’s been less than a month but this community has really grown on me. The past few weeks have been really eventful. A huge shoutout to my mentor, Željko for giving me the best on-boarding experience ever. In this short span, I got to meet the entire QTE & Release Engineering team. I also gained a new sense of professionalism and a clearer view of what it meant to be working as a community!

item.title: GSoCpedia: Chapter One
How should I use WebdriverIO?
item.description: WebdriverIO is Javascript based test automation framework built over Node.js. It is a custom implementation for selenium’s W3C webdriver API. Here’s why you should be using WebdriverIO for testing: It’s Front-end Friendly It Has the Power of Selenium It’s simplicity and easy syntax It’s Easily Extendable Let’s Get Started! WebdriverIO is a ‘npm’ package and runs on ‘Node.js‘. So, we need to install Node.js in our machine before installing WebdriverIO.
